Tucson puts a gentle hand on Talon's shoulder as he walks out with her, to =
find Straight Shot, who after a moment is now sitting outside the Ark as Ra=
ttrap and Nightshift prepare for the next step of the mission.  He approach=
es her with Talon and leans up against the wall, unsure of what to say or h=
ow to say it. 

Straight Shot looks up to him and then to the ground.

" I =
know, I acted like a real brat back there and if you're not happy with me I=
 understand."

Tucson lowers himself to sit on the ground beside his sister=
.  A gentile hand rubs Straight Shots quills as they appeared smoothed over=
 on her back.

" It's all right, we are all under a great amount of stress,=
 and in these times we all do things we don't mean to do.  What happened in=
 that room was not your fault nor was it Wheelies.  It has to do with Natur=
al incompatibility .  No matter how hard we all try to get past differences=
, they still exist.  I feel it best for Wheelie and everyone else, that he =
is placed in an environment where he will fit accordingly.  He will be far =
more content and so will everyone else, knowing that there is a place for e=
veryone, it just takes time to get there."



Perpetually on the move and c=
onstantly busy. 

On Aug 28, 2011, at 2:07 PM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly20=
02@...> wrote:

> Talon:
>  
> Talon nodded and said "It's understa=
ble that all are a little... stressed. "said sadly Talon"Situation is very =
bad; we should better go with her"
>  
> Talon walked slowly towards the ex=
it.
>  
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> From: magicquartz@...
> Date: =
Sun, 28 Aug 2011 01:19:07 -0400
> Subject: Re: Lessons to be Learned.
> 
> =

> 
> OOC: This is where it gets interesting.  Beware, Wheelie has just rub=
bed Tucson's scales the wrong way and btw, he IS RELATED TO RATCHET.  Which=
 explains his temper.
> 
> BIC:  Tucson grits his teeth to try and stop him=
self from making a grave mistake.  Wheelie was practically sending him over=
 the edge.  He could see it wasn't going to pan out with him after all.  In=
stead of getting angry although agitation is in his voice, Tucson turns to =
Leo Prime and to Wheelie.
> 
> " This doesn't seem to be working well is it=
?  Sorry Wheelie but if you can not work properly with command, I have no c=
hoice but to transfer you out of my sanction.  I've tried hard to avoid tha=
t but your insolence only goes so far with me.  I'm sure another sanction w=
ill take you in willingly, you have attributes they can use.  Leo, I trust =
you know someone who can use Wheelie, please see to the transfer if you cou=
ld."
> 
> He turns to Talon.
> 
> "I'm sorry you had to see this Talon.  I =
did try to keep my patience with him."
> 
> Straight Shot speaks up.  She l=
ooks at Wheelie completely upset.
> 
> " Thanks a lot Wheelie!  My brother =
was trying really hard to reach out to you and you go biting his hand off l=
ike a complete slag ball!  Thanks to you he's on thin ice with the Autobot =
Council!  Now this!?  HOW COULD YOU?!  I HAVE A GOOD MIND TA CARPET YOUR CH=
ASSE WITH EVERY QUILL ON MY BODY!" 
> 
> She darts out with tears in her ey=
es.  Rattrap tries to follow.  He stares at Wheelie.
> 
> " HAPPY NOW!?  GO=
OD!  I CAN'T WAIT TILL YOU GET THAT TRANSFER! IF WINGS GETS BOOTED IT'S ON =
YOUR BACK BUMPER!" 
> 
> He too leaves the room as upset as Straight Shot.
=
> 
> Tucson looks back at them.
> 
> " Leo, keep Wheelie here, Talon, if yo=
u could, I could use your help.  I've never had to console my sister and I =
could use some advice."
> 
> Nightshift comes back from his meditation at t=
he river, only to almost hit Straight Shot, while stopping short.  He knew =
right away what was troubling her.
> 
> " Uh oh, lemme guess, Wheelie huh? =
 Slag I knew that little bugger was trouble the moment he got here."
> 
> S=
traight Shot tries to compose herself.
> 
> " Yeah you called that one righ=
t.  And because of him, Tucson could lose his status.  He's making my broth=
er look like a fool and worst off is,  Leo isn't doing anything about it.  =
Oh sure, ten ta one he's favoring Wheelie, I see it, I'm not stupid.  Ooohh=
h!  This whole thing makes me so mad I wanna jab every quill on my body int=
o that little orange pest!"
> 
> Nightshift shifts into robot mode and sits=
 down with Straight Shot as does Rattrap , who puts a consoling arm around =
her.
> 
> " Hey, I know things don't look so cool right now but I didn't he=
ar your bro lose his temper, and I know when he does because the whole base=
 would've heard him.  That's why he's be'n watched and so far so good.  He =
may have handled himself nicely in there, from what I can tell.  And that's=
 what the council looks for in a leader. "
> 
> Rattrap grins.
> 
> " Good =
point, never thought of it that way.  Oh Wings actually told Leo ta transfe=
r him outa the Ark and assign him to another troop."
> 
> Nightshift nods.
=
> 
> " That's cool, at least he's still in the faction but different sancti=
on.  Not bad.  Not bad at all.  I would've done the same thing if I was in =
his shoes.  Now, Straight Shot, don't worry, your bro ain't go'n anywhere b=
ut where he is now.  Trust me, as long as he keeps his temper in check and =
makes decisions for the benefit of our troops he'll be fine."
> 
> He caref=
ully puts an arm around his prickly comrade.
> 
> Perpetually on the move a=
nd constantly busy. 
> 
> On Aug 27, 2011, at 10:50 PM, "adamsafran" <adams=
afran@...> wrote:
> 
>  
> 
> > An insult to his logic was definitely=
 a test to Tucson's already short temper. Yet he knew he had to keep that i=
n check if he was to keep his position. He turns to Wheelie with a narrowed=
 brow. Yet not one word is said. He then raises it.
> > 
> > " Hmmmm... So =
that's how you see me? If I'm not mistaken Wheelie I believe you have just =
crossed the line of insubordination. I'm giving you a chance to be part of =
the team but I see nothing in return on your part. Well, care to explain to=
 me the Autobot code of honor and what happens when a soldier behaves out o=
f line, going as far as insulting a Prime Officer? You seem to be quite int=
elligent, go on, tell me."
> > 
> > Rattrap and Straight Shot look to Wheel=
ie in shock.
> > 
> > " Looks like a certain little go cart's in for some s=
erious discipline. "
> > 
> > Straight Shot swallows hard.
> > 
> > " His v=
oice, it sounds just like Ratchet's voice when he was ready ta lose it."
> =
> 
> > Rattrap watches with amusement.
> > 
> > " Ooohhh so that's where Tu=
cson's temper comes from. Yep Wheelie is in big trouble."
> > 
> > Tucson e=
yes Wheelie with arms folded in his chest. His stare indicative of Ratchet =
when he was ready to lose his temper.
> > 
> 
> At this point, Wheelie stoo=
d up, "Yes, I say you are wrong. There's no such thing as a space bridge th=
at strong. You would simply see it from afar, with our own optics the senso=
rs abar. You cannot remotely hide such a hting, in the technology of our ti=
me or even that thing. To do such a thing, to rip apart time, is stupidly a=
bsurd, I call it this time. So if you are going to say we should waste our =
time going after what does not exist, I say thee nay."
> 
> Wheelie went on=
, "So, stop wasting oru time for such a stupid thing, or I will go out on m=
y own and bring. Rodimus is my friend, I won't leave him alone to face his =
end. If you are goin to be a boron, then I shall call you a nimrod and boro=
n."
> 
> Hissing, "Now, I would say you are wasting our time, on pointless =
things that we needn't to whine. So I say, I think you want my friend dead =
today."
> 
> At the Laurel and Hardy back and forth of Rattrap and Straight=
 SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "And you bring up Ratchet? Well he's dead. MEg=
atron blew off his head. And you seem to want Rodimus to end the same way. =
So I shall now not leave my friend astray."
> 
> And without a further word=
, Wheelie transformed to his vehicle mode, and raced off!
> 
> OOC - This i=
s how I see the character - at this point, he thinks it's utter nonsense to=
 waste time looking for a Space Bridge that there's no evidence of or anyth=
ing remotely suggesting, based upon Tuscon having a 'hunch' so he's going i=
nsubordinate and off on his own. TO him, a Space Bridge would e impossible =
to hdie (a la the third Transformers movie Dark of the Moon), and so wastin=
g time scanning for it is a fool's errand. So he's going off to 'look' for =
Rodimus on his own, unless stopped or otherwis einterfered with as he's afr=
aid that Tuscon is purposefully stalling to prevent them from going after R=
odimus. He respects Leo Prime, but he's friends with Rorimus, and he has a =
very low regard for Tuscon, and at this point in his processor Tuscon decid=
ing to check for something to him that has infinitesimal chances of having =
been done and stall a gridwide search is abaondment of his friend. Anyways,=
 wondrful posting and good luck!
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
